Revocation of Grants
The grantee shall advise the Office of Education whenever, in the
opinion of the grantee, there is reason to believe that circumstances may
necessitate revocation*
Grants may be revoked in whole or in part by the Office of Education,
after consultation with the grantee, due to the inability of the grantee
to carry out the research for which the grant is made, or non-compliance
with the conditions of the grant.
A revocation shall not affect any financial commitment which, in the
judgment of the Office of Education, had become film prior to receipt by
the grantee of a notice of recovation. Thereupon, the grantee shall re¬
duce, insofar as possible, the amount of outstanding commitments and repay
by check made payable to the U. S* Office of Education the uncommitted
balance of all funds which shall have been paid to the grantee by the
Office of Education under the terms of the particular grant concerned.
Allowable Costs
In determining the allowable costs for a research project, the Office
of Education will consider all costs which are clearly attributable to the
conduct of the research.
Direct Costs
The Office of Education will consider as direct the costs which are
specifically identifiable as having been incurred in the conduct of the
research. Direct costs which are applicable to (1) the research project,
and (2) other projects, programs, or activities of the grantee, shall be
equitably apportioned to the respective projects, programs, or activities
to which they apply. Examples of items which may be considered as allow¬
able direct costs are explained below.
Salaries - This item includes the salaries of persons employed
on the research project for the time actually devoted to the research
project, including full-time and part-time staff, and consultants. Salary
estimates should be based on the rates of pay normally paid by the grantee
for services of the same or similar nature as those to be performed in
connection with the research project, bhere any person works less than
full-time on the research project, current and reasonable estimates of the
time spent on the research project may be used in the absence of actual
time records in determining the part of the salary to be charged to the
research project.
Employee Services and Benefits - This item includes the costs
of employee services and benefits, such as insurance, pension payments,
and social security, which are normally provided by the grantee to its
employees. Such costs for the personnel for whom salaries are included
under the above paragraph are allowable*
